image.altText: A group of people walking towards the camera, with the coroner in the centre of the picture

props.synopsis: The Yuendumu community is preparing for the coroner to arrive to hand down her long-awaited findings and recommendations into the 2019 police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Coronial findings into Kumanjayi Walker's death in custody almost here

image.altText: A young child sitting at a table in front of three pots of paint, holding a paint brush over a leaf with paint strokes.

props.synopsis: A veteran childcare centre director is speaking out about inadequate vetting of new workers' employment histories in the Northern Territory, which she says leaves potential misconduct unchecked.

title.children: Childcare centre director speaks out over NT staff vetting concerns

image.altText: An artist sitting in his studio, surrounded by paintings and brushes, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Franck Gohier has created paintings, prints and sculptures that are on show in galleries across the world, sharing his unique take on all things typically Territorian with a wide audience.

title.children: How Darwin's 'wild' world shapes Franck Gohier's artistic vision

props.synopsis: In the Northern Territory’s youth court, where proceedings are sometimes prohibited from being reported in the media, the ABC spent time observing what happened in the courtroom. Here’s what we found.

title.children: What happens to young kids who end up in the NT’s Youth Court?

image.altText: Black and white photo of sheep and mounted drover in an open field.

props.synopsis: In 1882, drover Wallace Caldwell led the longest sheep drive in Australian history, but his story was almost lost to time.

title.children: Epic 3,500km trek, 11,000 sheep, and the young drover history forgot

image.altText: A woman talking into an ABC News microphone, with two police officers standing either side of her.

props.synopsis: The NT government will rewrite youth crime laws this month to reclassify 13 offences as "serious", requiring children who commit them to attend court rather than go through youth diversion.

title.children: 'Will not tolerate repeat offenders': NT flags youth crime law changes

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Gunlom Falls has been closed since 2019, when damage to a sacred men's site sparked a long-running legal dispute that ultimately reached the High Court.

title.children: Popular Kakadu swimming spot reopened after six-year closure

image.altText: A tennis player stretches out to hit a ball back over the net.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur sets up a showdown with Novak Djokovic at Wimbledon, as Daria Kasatkina goes out in straight sets.

title.children: De Minaur faces mammoth Wimbledon test after victory

image.altText: Virgil van Dijk and Andrew Robertson carry wreaths of red flowers in the shape of football shirts

props.synopsis: The last time many of his friends in football made the trip to Porto was two weeks prior, for Jota's wedding.

title.children: Liverpool players join mourning family at Diogo Jota's funeral

image.altText: Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra smiles and waves through a rolled-down car window.

props.synopsis: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is a photogenic, wealthy daughter of a powerful political family that has been at the top of Thai politics. But now she has fallen from grace.

title.children: Shinawatra dynasty dominated Thailand, but it may have run out of power

image.altText: A room full of people performing tactile Auslan and smiling

props.synopsis: Very little progress has been made on "once-in-a-generation" disability reforms since they were first announced in 2023, leaving many in the sector concerned some people could be left behind.

title.children: As the government clamps the NDIS, is this the future of disability support?

image.altText: A Palestinian looks on at the site of Israeli strike at refugee camp in Gaza

props.synopsis: Israel's security cabinet is expected to meet after the Jewish Sabbath to discuss the nation's next steps as Benjamin Netanyahu heads to Washington for talks with Donald Trump.

title.children: Israel mulls response as Hamas says it's ready for ceasefire talks 'immediately'

image.altText: Daniel is wearing a black suit with a white button up shirt

props.synopsis: The National NAIDOC Awards have wrapped up for another year. Here's your guide to the winners list.

title.children: Daniel Hunt wins coveted NAIDOC Person of the Year

image.altText: Silhouette of a woman's head coloured purple with small puzzle pieces falling out of the back

props.synopsis: After witnessing my mum's cognitive decline and with dementia now the leading cause of death for Australian women, I can't help but wonder: Will I be among them?

title.children: My mother was diagnosed with dementia. I'm doing everything to minimise my risk

image.altText: Tongan women in traditional dress sitting on floor holding strands of plant over a tanoa

props.synopsis: Demand for kava is growing so large in Australia that Woolworths has started stocking the beverage, known for its calming effects. But Pacific leaders say the crop's success comes with problems.

title.children: In the Pacific, 'who has kava is king' but some fear it's hurting families

image.altText: An old Tibetan man in red robes leans over to pat a koala, held by a young girl. A blond4e woman and a small boy sit beside them

props.synopsis: To Tibetans all over the world, His Holiness is a hugely important spiritual and political leader.

title.children: The Dalai Lama turns 90 and delivers Tibetan Buddhists an answer

image.altText: A close up shot of an older man frowning while wearing a white hat reading Make America Great Again

props.synopsis: The Department of Homeland Security says the US has deported to South Sudan eight migrants who had been held for more than a month by the US at a military base in Djibouti.

title.children: US completes deportation of eight men to South Sudan after weeks of legal wrangling

image.altText: Australia batters Cameron Green and Steve Smith talk during a Test.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith cops a nasty blow on his injured finger, Cameron Green gets back in the runs, and Beau Webster falls in the rain. Here are five quick hits from the third day of the second Test in Grenada.

title.children: Five quick hits: Smith cops a nasty blow and rain unsettles Webster

image.altText: Musician DOBBY looking off into the distance in low light, wearing a feather necklace

props.synopsis: When Aboriginal-Filipino rapper DOBBY made his ARIA award-winning album Warrangu: River Story, it set him on a journey of spiritual self-reflection. Now he's using his voice to send a powerful message around climate, racism and injustice.

title.children: How Aboriginal-Filipino rapper DOBBY found his voice

image.altText: A photo of a woman with red hair, shot from behind, looking at a hung artwork

props.synopsis: Slow looking has become profoundly counter-cultural. And anything that serves as an antidote to chronic distraction, that pulls our gaze from pulsing, popping screens to quieter skies surely should be applauded.

title.children: For better mental health and sharper writing, consider slow looking

image.altText: A person making coffee with an espresso machine in a cozy kitchen setting.

props.synopsis: Espresso machines can save you money, but they require a little cleaning and maintenance to keep them running smoothly. Here’s what’s recommended.

title.children: The best ways to clean your home coffee machine

image.altText: Cassie looking away from the camera smiling, headshot, make-up, earrings

props.synopsis: Without Cassie, Sean "Diddy" Combs would not have faced trial. She has emerged as a powerful figure after bravely telling her story in a New York courtroom.

title.children: Cassie has emerged as a powerful figure in Sean 'Diddy' Combs case

image.altText: Mike Pritchard, an espionage expert, shows his spycraft collection.

props.synopsis: From World War II's enigma machine, to a Stasi camera concealed in a flower box and even original letters from the James Bond author, this every day Sydneysider has plenty of spy memorabilia in storage.

title.children: The Sydneysider with three of the world's most sought-after historical artefacts

image.altText: A lifeguard watches swimmers in the Seine river

props.synopsis: Parisians will be allowed to swim in the River Seine legally for the first time since 1923, following a multi-million dollar clean-up project.

title.children: Paris opens River Seine for public swimming after century-long ban

image.altText: GettyImages-2223689253

props.synopsis: Belgium's Jasper Philipsen claims the first stage of the Tour de France as Tadej Pogačar makes a safe start.

title.children: Dream comes true for Belgian in emotional Tour de France scenes

image.altText: Actor Aaron Pederson in Ivan Sen's movie Mystery Road. He's nominated for Best Actor at the 2013 Asia Pacific Screen Awards in Brisbane. December 2013

props.synopsis: To mark the start of NAIDOC Week, we've collated some of the most joyous, dramatic and vital screen work from First Nation creatives (and it's all free to enjoy!)

title.children: Sick of paying for streaming services? These films and TV series are free

image.altText: a man searches a suitcase

props.synopsis: Police allege two 18-year-olds tried to smuggle the drugs into the country by wrapping them in towels soaked in vinegar and chilli.

title.children: Four charged over alleged cocaine smuggling involving vinegar and chilli

image.altText: Julian McMahon smiling while wearing a suit with a bow tie at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: Julian McMahon got his start on Home and Away and went on to star in Charmed, Nip/Tuck and Fantastic Four, among other TV shows and films.

title.children: Australian actor Julian McMahon dies aged 56

image.altText: Artist stands over table of his artwork, motioning at them with his hands

props.synopsis: Cole White lives with Down syndrome and is often non-verbal — but through art, he has found a new way to express himself.

title.children: Cole started creating art to decorate his mum's house. Now he's had his first solo exhibition

image.altText: Commuters board a Sydney train

props.synopsis: The fare-free days in NSW mark the end of the long pay dispute between the Minns government and rail unions that caused major chaos on the state's rail network.

title.children: 'Disruption is over': Two days of free train travel in NSW

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands while sitting down and looking at each other in the face.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he has discussed air defences with his US counterpart, agreeing to work on increasing Kyiv's capability to "defend the sky" as Russian attacks escalate.

title.children: Trump and Zelenskyy discuss US weapons for Ukrainian defence

image.altText: Hugh Sinclair of the Waratahs walking through a tunnel by the British and Irish Lions

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions remain undefeated on their Australian tour after edging out a spirited NSW Waratahs 21-10 in Sydney.

title.children: Sinclair retires on 'cloud nine' as Lions edge spirited Waratahs in Sydney

image.altText: Alex Chidiac of Australia tackled by Marta Cox of Panama.

props.synopsis: Missing a host of their star players, the Matildas go down to Panama 1-0 in the first of two friendlies in West Australia.

title.children: Understrength Matildas fall to physical Panama in opening friendly

image.altText: A wombat.

props.synopsis: Dianna Bisset finds a dead wombat on the side of the road, with a small bullet mark just behind its ear. In town, there's no mystery as to why this protected species is in the crosshairs.

title.children: Someone in NSW's tablelands is shooting perfectly healthy wombats. Locals know why
